gurmukhi: Bjy hwbsI hwlbI kaukbMdRI ] cly brbrI ArmnI Cwf qMdRI ] KuilE K`g KUnI qhwN eyk gwjI ] duhUM sYx m`DM nicE jwie qwjI ]464]
transliteration: Bhaje Haabsdhaalabikaoukhandree|| Chale Barbariarmanichhaad Tadree|| Khulio Khagg Koonitahaan Ek Gadjee|| Duhoon Sain Maddhan Nachio Jaae Taajee||464||
translation: The negroes and people of other countries fled away; and in the same way, the barbarians of Armenia also ran away; there one of the warriors taking out his sword, caused his horse to dance between both the armies.464.

gurmukhi: liKE ju`D jMgI mhwN jMg krqw ] CuiBE C`qRDwrI rxM C`qR hrqw ] durM durdgwmI dlM ju`D jyqw ] CuBy C`qR hMqw jXM ju`D hyqw ]465]
transliteration: Lakhio Juddh Janimahaan Jan Kartaa|| Chhoubhio Chhattradhaariranan Chhattra Hartaa|| Duran Durdgadmidalan Juddh Jetaa|| Chhoubhe Chhatra Bantaa Jayan Juddh Hetaa||465||
translation: The Lord, the Great Creator of the wars saw all this and the destroyer of the great canopied-kings, the Lord (Kalki) became enraged; that Lord was the conqueror of the noteworthy most tyrannical armies and he got terrible infuriated.465.

gurmukhi: mhw kRoD kY bwx C`fy ApwrM ] kty t`trM Pauj Pu`tI niRpwrM ] igrI lu`Q ju`QM imly h`Q b`QM ] igry AMg BMgM rxM mu`K ju`QM ]466]
transliteration: Mahaa Krodh Kai Baan Chhadde Apaaran|| Kate Tattran Phauj Phouttinripaaran|| Giriloutth Joutthan Mile Bath Batthanh|| Gire An Bhanadg Ranan Moukkh Joutthan||466||
translation: He discharged arrows in great rage and the army of that king was chopped and knocked down; the corpses fell in groups; heaps of hands, waists and other broken limbs fell down.466.

gurmukhi: krY kyl kMkI iklkYq kwlI ] qjY jÍwl mwlw mhwN joq jÍwlI ] hsY BUqM pRyqM qutY q`iQ qwlM ] iPrY gaur duarI puAY ruMf mwlM ]467]
transliteration: Darai Kal Kanki Kilkait Kaalee|| Tajai Jvaal Maalaa Mahaan Jot Jvaalee|| Hasai Bhootan Pretan Toutai Tatth(i) Taalan|| Phirai Gaddd Dauripaui Round Maalan||467||
translation: The crows shouted caw and the flames of fire arose creating crackling noise; the ghosts and fiends laughed there and the goddess Kali ran, while stringing the rosaries of skulls.467.

gurmukhi: kry ju`D kRu`DM ] qjY bwx su`DM ] bkY mwr mwrM ] qjY bwx DwrM ]468]
transliteration: Dare Juddh Kruddhan|| Tahai Baan Suddhan|| Bakai Maar Maaran|| Tajai Baan Dhaaran||468||
translation: The warriors, getting enraged, waged war and discharged arrows; they were shouting “kill, kill”, while showering arrows.468.

gurmukhi: igry AMg BMgM ] ncy jMg rMgM ] idvM dyv dyKY ] DnM DMn lyKY ]469]
transliteration: Gire An Bhngadg|| Nache Jan Ranadg|| Divan Dev Dekhai|| Dhanan Lakhai||469||
translation: Dancing in the mood of fighting, the warriors fell with broken limbs; and both the gods and demons, on seeing them said “bravo, bravo”.469.

gurmukhi: As lY klkI kir kop BirE ] rx rMg surMg ibKY ibcirE ] gih bwx kiRpwx ibKY n firE ] irs so rx ic`qR bic`qR kirE ]470]
transliteration: As Lai Kalki Kar(i) Kop Bhario|| Ran Ran Suran Bikhai Bichario|| Gadh Baan Kridaan Bikhai Na Dario|| Ris So Ran Chittra Bachittra Kario||470||
translation: The Lord (Kalki) taking his sword in his hand, became filled with anger and began to roam in the battlefield in fighting mood; holding his bow and sword fearlessly and angrily, he began to move in the battlefield in a queer way.470.

gurmukhi: kr hwr hQXwr Anyk DrY ] rx rMg hTI kir kop prY ] gih pwn kiRpwn indwn iBry ] rx jUJ mry iPrqy n iPry ]471]
transliteration: Kar Haak Hathyaar Anek Ddarai|| Ran Ran Hathikar(i) Kop Darai|| Gadh Paan Kridaan Nidaan Bhire|| Ran Joojh Dare Phire Na Hire||471||
translation: Holding various weapons and challenging with anger and persistence, he fell upon the opponents in war; holding his sword in his hand, he became engrossed in fighting and did not recede.471.

gurmukhi: aumfI jn Gor GmMf Gtw ] cmkMq kiRpwn su ib`j Ctw ] dl bYrn ko pg dÍY n Ptw ] rup kY rx mo iPr Awn jutw ]472]
transliteration: Oumdijan Ghor Ghamannd Ghataa|| Chamkant Kridaan Su Bijj Chhataa|| Dal Bairan Ko Pag Dvai Na Phataa|| Roup Kai Ran Mo Phir Aan Joutaa||472||
translation: Like the lightning of the rushing clouds, the swords gleamed; the army of the enemies did not even recede two steps backwards and in its fury, came to fight again in the war-arena.472.

gurmukhi: kr kop iPry rx rMg hTI ] qp kY ijm pwvk jÍwl BTI ] pRqnw pRq kY pRqnw iekTI ] irs kY rx mo rup sYx jutI ]473]
transliteration: Kar Kop Phire Ran Ran Hathee|| Tap Kai Jim Paavak Jvaal Bhathee|| Pratnaa Prat Kai Pratnaa Ikathee|| Ris Kai Ran Mo Roup Sain Joutee||473||
translation: The persistent warriors were getting angry in the war like the furnace with blazing flames; the army revolved and gathered together and was engrossed in fighting with great rage.473.

gurmukhi: qrvwr Apwr hjwr lsYN ] hir ijau Arky pRqAMg fsYN ] rq fUb smY rx AYs hsYN ] jn ib`jul juAwl krwl ksYN ]474]
transliteration: Tarvaar Apaar Bajaar Lasain|| Har(i) Jio Arke Pratan Dasain|| Rat Doob Samai Ran Ais Hasain|| Jan Bijjul Juaal Karaal Kasain||474||
translation: Thousands of swords were looking magnificent and it appeared that the snakes were stinging every limb; the swords seemed smiling like the flash of the dreadful lightning.474.
